articles.author: Gabriel Stargardter
articles.description: France holds a parliamentary run-off election on Sunday that will reconfigure the political landscape, with opinion polls forecasting the far-right National Rally (RN) will win the most votes but likely fall short of a majority.
articles.title: Far right bids for power as France holds parliamentary election

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: The champagne was on ice at the far-right National Rally's (RN) headquarters, but the celebratory mood swiftly turned to disbelief when the first projected results from Sunday's parliamentary election appeared on TV screens.
articles.title: France election: How the far-right lost

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Jeff Mason, Bianca Flowers
articles.description: She worries Republican donors, has name recognition, and Democratic Party heavyweights are beginning to line up behind her.
articles.title: Could Kamala Harris beat Donald Trump in November's presidential race?

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: An increasingly embattled U.S. President Joe Biden will hit the campaign trail in the battleground state of Pennsylvania on Sunday, as House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries meets with senior House Democrats to discuss the president's candidacy.
articles.title: Biden to campaign in battleground Pennsylvania as Democrats mull his candidacy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Iranian-backed Hezbollah militant group said on Sunday it launched a drone attack on Mount Hermon in the Israeli-occupied Syrian Golan Heights where Israel has a key surveillance centre.
articles.title: Hezbollah launches drone attack on Mount Hermon in Israeli-occupied Syrian Golan Heights

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas is waiting for a response from Israel on its ceasefire proposal, two officials from the Palestinian group said on Sunday, five days after it accepted a key part of a U.S. plan aimed at ending the nine-month war in Gaza.
articles.title: Hamas says it's waiting for Israeli response on ceasefire proposal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Democracy is not in good shape, Pope Francis said on Sunday, urging politicians to shun populism and instead work together to build stronger societies and tackle voter apathy.
articles.title: Democracy is in bad health, Pope Francis says

articles.author: Gopal Sharma
articles.description: Heavy rains triggered landslides and flash floods killing at least 11 people in the last 36 hours in Nepal and blocking key highways and roads, officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Heavy rains trigger landslides in Nepal, 11 killed, 8 missing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hungary's Prime Minister Viktor Orban arrived in Beijing on Monday for talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping, Orban's press chief told state news agency MTI.
articles.title: Hungary PM Orban arrives in Beijing for talks with Chinese President Xi

articles.author: Stefanno Sulaiman, Rae Wee
articles.description: Indonesia's President-elect Prabowo Subianto wants to give school children free meals, but the plan and his pledge to be 'daring' on spending have the country's debt and currency markets on edge.
articles.title: Prabowo's free-meal plan stirs investor fears about Indonesia's finances
